thread.title: British Prime Minster Explains Holding Hands With President Trump
thread.title_full: British Prime Minster Explains Holding Hands With President Trump

author: Jack Davis
title: British Prime Minster Explains Holding Hands With President Trump
text:
British Prime Minster Explains Holding Hands With President Trump "... he said it might be a bit awkward.” by Jack Davis March 22, 2017 at 11:15am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
In a new interview, British Prime Minister Theresa May refers to President Donald Trump as “a gentleman” as she explained how it came to be that the President of the United States exited the White House holding her hand. 
“I think he was actually being a gentleman,” May told Vogue magazine, laughing about the memory. “We were about to walk down a ramp, and he said it might be a bit awkward.” 
May was the first foreign leader to make a state visit to Trump. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I like to think we got on,” she said in the interview. “I mean, obviously he has, uh . . . it was a stunning election victory, in that he’s someone who has not been involved in politics.” Trump, May hold hands outside White House – Economic Times https://t.co/H3SfgsElAC pic.twitter.com/Rc5sQlSTsB 
When asked by her interviewer whether she confronted Trump about his comments on women, comments she had once said were “unacceptable,” she hedged. Advertisement - story continues below 
“We don’t comment on private conversations that take place. All I would say is, I’ve been very clear: I’m not afraid to raise issues. And the nature of the relationship is such that we should be able to be frank and open with each other,” she said. 
May, Britain’s second female prime minister, was asked whether the photo of her with Trump, walking hand in hand, is indicative of the type of relationship Margaret Thatcher had with former President Ronald Reagan. 
“There can only ever be one Margaret Thatcher,” she said. “I’m Theresa May. I do things my way.” Theresa May the Vogue star! Prime Minister poses for photoshoot with Annie Leibovitz https://t.co/BxOxSMGEUo pic.twitter.com/EhgfHXRM4V 
— Daily Mail U.K. (@DailyMailUK) March 20, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
